disclaimerText: This forecast is intended to provide information on expected pollution levels in areas of significant public exposure. It may not apply in very specific locations close to unusually strong or short-lived local sources of pollution.

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Friday 6 May to end of Friday 6 May GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Friday is expected to be warm and mainly dry.<br/><br/>Westerly winds should ensure little pollution import and enough air movement to disperse local emissions<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>

currentForecast.forecastSummary: Low air pollution forecast valid from Saturday 7 May to end of Saturday 7 May GMT
currentForecast.forecastText: Rain and drizzle clearing during the morning to become warm with sunny spells. Largely cloudy in the evening.<br/><br/>The winds should become more northerly, but still with Atlantic origins so bringing little imported pollution. Air movement is also expected to be sufficient for adequate dispersal of local emissions.<br/><br/>Air pollution is expected to remain 'Low' throughout the forecast period for the following pollutants:<br/><br/>Nitrogen Dioxide<br/>Ozone<br/>PM10 Particulate<br/>PM2.5 Particulate<br/>Sulphur Dioxide<br/><br/>
